text: Planomicrobium mcmeekinii is a species of bacteria.Jung-Hoon Yoon; et al, Planomicrobium koreense gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium isolated from the Korean traditional fermented seafood jeotgal, and transfer of Planococcus okeanokoites (Nakagawa et al. 1996) and Planococcus mcmeekinii (Junge et al. 1998) to the genus Planomicrobium. International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology (2001), 51, p. 1511 It is gram-positive. The cells are rod shaped. It doesn't form spores. It grows from 0–37 °C. Planomicrobium mcmeekinii belongs to the family Planococcaceae. == References == ==Other websites== *Euzéby: List of Prokaryotic names with Standing in Nomenclature (LPSN) Category:Gram-positive bacteria
title: Planomicrobium mcmeekinii
